comments.body: Missing "*used* across the core component of ROOT"?

If you are going to touch this stuff, you should probably look into fixing [ROOT-9406](https://sft.its.cern.ch/jira/browse/ROOT-9406) by replacing the `#ifdef` with a runtime check (i.e. compute `ROOTSYS` from libdir) + relative dirs (e.g. includedir = ROOTSYS + "/include", etc).

I think we can probably do that. We can get the binary location to root.exe at runtime (we do something like that in cling) and we can get the library directory of libCore.so using dladdr I think. I am not sure for the rest -- we do not have a reliable way to find the `etc` dir for instance.

This is probably a good thing to do but outside of the PR I think.
I think that this refactoring is lower priority than fixing the standing Jira issues, so it might make sense to fix those first, then do the refactoring.
This refactoring is necessary to fix the ROOT-10354 which breaks quite a few things with modules.
That issue really just looks like a consequence of what's described in [ROOT-9403](https://sft.its.cern.ch/jira/browse/ROOT-9403).

The issue I am fixing is orthogonal to any installation problems. The issue shows up because we have instructed cling to pick up all modulemap files on the -I path. If we fix all installation issues of ROOT the ROOT-10354 will still exist because we will still find a set of modulemap files which we are not supposed to see.
